hints.content: Start by understanding what a 'single divisor triplet' means. A triplet (a, b, c) is considered a single divisor triplet if there is exactly one integer that divides all three numbers. Think about how you would determine the divisors of a number.

Consider how to efficiently find the divisors of each number in the input array. You can loop through numbers from 1 to the square root of each number to find divisors. This will help you later when you need to check for common divisors.

Remember that a triplet consists of three distinct elements from the array. Make sure to account for the uniqueness of the elements when forming triplets. You might want to use combinations to generate these triplets.
Think about how to check if a number is a divisor of another number. You can use the modulus operator. For example, if 'x' is a divisor of 'y', then 'y % x' should equal 0.

When checking for common divisors among a triplet, you can maintain a count of how many times each divisor divides the triplet. If a divisor divides all three numbers, increment a count for that divisor.
Consider edge cases where the input array may have fewer than three elements. You should handle these cases early and decide what to return, as no triplet can be formed.
Once you have the counts of common divisors for each triplet, you need to filter these counts to find those that equal exactly one. This will help you identify the valid single divisor triplets.

Think about how to iterate through all possible triplets efficiently. You may want to use nested loops or a combination generator, but be cautious of the time complexity, especially for larger arrays.
Keep track of the number of valid single divisor triplets you find. You can initialize a counter at the start and increment it each time you find a valid triplet.
Finally, ensure you return the count of valid triplets as the output. Double-check the format of your return value to match the expected output type (e.g., an integer).

questionNotes: The input is an array of integers.
Triplets must consist of distinct elements from the array.
Return the count of triplets that have exactly one common divisor.
Handle cases where the input array has fewer than three elements.
